content.description: Step 1:<math alttext="H 2 gas plus I C l gas react to produce H I gas plus H C l gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>(slow)Step 2:<math alttext="H I gas plus I C l gas react to produce H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>(fast)
content.question: Which of the following represents the overall chemical equation for the reaction and the rate law for elementary step 2 ?

choices.label: The overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 gas plus 2 I C l gas react to produce H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>; the rate law for step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2, times the molar concentration of H I, times the molar concentration of I C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 gas plus 2 I C l gas react to produce 2 H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; the rate law for step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2, times the molar concentration of I C l squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 gas plus I C l gas react to produce H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; the rate law for step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2, times the molar concentration of I C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo stretchy="false">[</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo stretchy="false">]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 gas plus 2 I C l gas react to produce 2 H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; the rate law for step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H I, times the molar concentration of I C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 gas plus 2 I C l gas react to produce 2 H C l gas plus I 2 gas " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>ICl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>; the rate law for step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H I, times the molar concentration of I C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>HI</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mtext>ICl</mtext></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
